summary: This is an email chain from August 13, 2019, containing a summary of voluntary interviews conducted by the OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY with Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) employees regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details accounts from prison staff about the discovery of Epstein's body, failures in protocol (missed counts, non-working cameras, missing cellmate), and notes that the two officers who discovered Epstein declined to be interviewed.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: The primary recipient of the draft email containing the interview summaries. Likely a supervisor or colleague at the USAO.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Discovered Epstein's body on the morning of August 10, 2019, after responding to a radio call. He performed CPR and questioned officers about the missed inmate counts and missing cellmate.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: One of the two officers who discovered Epstein's body. She admitted to Lt. that she and Officer Thomas did not conduct the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: One of the two officers who discovered Epstein's body. He was performing CPR when Lt. arrived and stated 'we messed up' and 'we didn't do the counts.'

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: Assisted Epstein with making a phone call a few days before his death. He dialed a number for Epstein on an unrecorded legal line and left him with Officers Noel and Thomas.

persons.name: Capt.
persons.context: Oversees the entire prison and the lieutenants. He stated he had given oral orders for Epstein to have a cellmate at all times but was not briefed on the cellmate's move or the camera issues.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019. The document details the discovery of his body and the circumstances leading up to his death.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was moved out of the cell prior to Epstein's death. Capt. was unaware of this move until after Epstein was found.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Identified by full name as one of the officers who discovered Epstein. She and Michael Thomas did not agree to speak with investigators.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Identified by full name as one of the officers who discovered Epstein. He and Tova Noel did not agree to speak with investigators.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the draft email containing the interview summaries from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC's Special Housing Unit (SHU) at approximately 6:33 a.m. Officer Thomas was performing CPR when Lt. arrived.

events.title: Missed Inmate Counts
events.description: Officers Noel and Thomas failed to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts on the night leading to Epstein's death.

events.title: Voluntary Interviews of MCC Staff
events.description: OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted approximately 2-hour voluntary interviews with several MCC employees (Lt., Lt., Capt.) regarding Epstein's death.

events.title: Failed Interview Attempts
events.description: FBI and OIG agents attempted to interview officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, but they declined to speak and agents were unable to serve subpoenas.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (USAO-SDNY office)
keyFacts: Epstein's cellmate, Reyes, had been moved out of the cell, leaving Epstein alone on the night of his death, contrary to orders that he have a cellmate at all times.
The two officers on duty, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, admitted to failing to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts.
The camera system in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) where Epstein was held was not working at the time of his death.
Officers Noel and Thomas declined to be interviewed by investigators and could not be served with subpoenas at that time.
A few days before his death, Epstein made a phone call on an unrecorded MCC line designated for legal conversations, which was dialed for him by Lt.
